byline.original: By MICHAEL CORKERY and NATHANIEL POPPER

abstract: Goldman Sachs, traditionally bank of rich and powerful, is opening consumer lending unit it will run through website or app, allowing it compete with brick and mortar institutions by eliminating overhead; plan is part of trend toward using Internet to upend traditional business of finance, but carries considerable risk.
lead_paragraph: The unit will eliminate the costs of bank branches and tellers to allow Goldman to charge lower interest rates and still make a profit. But the venture holds risks.

headline.main: Goldman Sachs Plans to Offer Consumer Loans Online, Adopting Start-Ups’ Tactics
headline.print_headline: Goldman Plans Online Lending for Consumers

snippet: The unit will eliminate the costs of bank branches and tellers to allow Goldman to charge lower interest rates and still make a profit. But the venture holds risks.
